0                                      2              *******************************************************************
                                       3              *                                                                 *
                                       4              *     WYLBUR/370 - Release VI - Class I - Stanford Proprietary    *
                                       5              *                                                                 *
                                       6              *******************************************************************
                                       7                       HIBAL
                                     988
 000000                00000 08F58   989              WYLACT   CSECT
                                     993              ACT      IDENT 2025                11:49:19 01/25/02  (SLP)
                                     996             +
                                     997    01-IDENT +         ENTRY ACT2025
                                     998             +
 000000 15C1C3E3F2F0F2F5             999    01-IDENT +ACT2025  DC    AL1(21),C'ACT2025,15MAR04,12:40'
                                    1000             +*
                                    1002              *
                                    1003              *   Modification history
                                    1004              *
                                    1005              *     9-Mar-1995   M. Durket
                                    1006              *
                                    1007              *     Make sure that every new active file contains not only
                                    1008              *     an AINFO record, but also a VIEW record. This should
                                    1009              *     prevent the WYLBUR CPU loops and multiple active file
                                    1010              *     logic errors resulting from attempts to ACTXPUT the
                                    1011              *     VIEW record when the active file space is full.
                                    1012              *
                                    1013              *     See the comments in the ACTOPEN routine for how to
                                    1014              *     reproduce the bug.
                                    1015              *
                                    1016              *     Additionally, make sure the CLRMULT updates the CPATCLR
                                    1017              *     value. Also, make sure that CLRMULT doesn't do an ACTOPEN
                                    1018              *     without first checking to see if an ACTPURGE should be done.
                                    1019              *     In the case above, WYLBUR would still continue to loop on
                                    1020              *     the save of the active files in the case of disconnect,
                                    1021              *     because SIGNOFF issues the SAVE command with a CLEAR option.
                                    1022              *     This causes CLRMULT to be called, and CLRMULT automatically
                                    1023              *     picks the first non-cleared active file (which won't be the
                                    1024              *     case here) or opens a new empty one (which is the case and
                                    1025              *     causes ACTOPEN to bomb on the ACTXPUT of the AINFO record).
                                    1026              *
                                    1027              *     Sheesh.
                                    1028              *
                                    1029                       REGS  FSR,,,,,,,BR,(WAR,LSR),PAR,PBR,CPR,CVR,SPR,RAR
-                                   1166                       SYSDEFN ,                 Define installation params
-                                   1168                       LCLA  &PATMAX             Max. pattern length
                                    1169              &PATMAX  SETA  200                 (An arbitrary number)
-                                   1171                       PUSH  DSECTS
 USING  CP,R11                      1182             =         USING (CP),(CV)
 USING  CV,R12
 000016                00000 08F58  1201             =         POP   PRINT

0                                   6797              *
                                    6798              *    LNINFO -- Line Prefix Information
                                    6799              *
                                    6800              *      This information is saved in extended edit files in this
                                    6801              *      format.  Be careful not to change this format without
                                    6802              *      making sure that extended edit file don't change.
                                    6803              *
                                    6804              *  ** CAUTION **
                                    6805              *  NOTE:
                                    6806              *  AS OF OCTOBER 1990,  THIS INFO IS NO LONGER USED OR KEPT.
                                    6807              *  THIS INFO (IE. TIME OF CHANGE, USER WHO DID CHANGE) IS
                                    6808              *  NO LONGER SAVED AS A PREFIX WITH EACH LINE OF THE ACTIVE
                                    6809              *  FILE.   BECAUSE WE CANNOT CHANGE EXTENDED EDIT FILES,
                                    6810              *  THIS FIELD IS NOW ** SET TO ZEROS ** IN ALL FUTURE
                                    6811              *  EXTENDED EDIT FILES.
                                    6812              *
                                    6813              *  THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ABOVE IS MINIMAL, WE DO NOT
                                    6814              *  SAVE THE PREFIX WITH EACH LINE OF THE ACTIVE FILE.  BUT
                                    6815              *  ALL THE CODE THAT DEALS WITH EXTENDED EDIT FILES REMAINS.
                                    6816              *  WE CAN NOT AX IT UNTIL WE GET RID OF EXTENDED EDIT FORMAT
                                    6817              *  WHICH REQUIRES ANOTHER METHOD FOR SAVING MULTIPLE ACTIVE
                                    6818              *  FILES AND REQUIRES A METHOD OF DEALING WITH EXISTING
                                    6819              *  EDIT FORMAT FILES.  AT SOME POINT (WHEN EXTENDED EDIT
                                    6820              *  FILES ARE AXED), IT WOULD BE GOOD TO GET RID OF ALL THIS
                                    6821              *  IRRELEVANT PREFIX CODE.  AND SUCH IS THAT.
                                    6822              *  UND DAT ISH DAS.
                                    6823              *
                                    6824              *
 000000                00000 00008  6825              LNINFO   RECORD BEGIN
                                    6833  1           *LNFLAG  FLAG
                                    6834  1           *        FLAG  (LNFMARK,X'40')     - Line has been changed
                                    6835  1           *LNID    DS    CL3                 User id
                                    6836  1           *LNCLCK  DS    F                   High order word of CLOCK
 000000                             6837  1                      DS    8X                  ALWAYS ZEROS, NOT USED
 000008                00008 00008  6838                       END

 0005A6 58E0 7BC6/0DEE       01124  8253                       ACALL ACTXPUT             Save record
                                    8257              *
                                    8258              *   Ensure that there is always a VIEW record. This should
                                    8259              *   eliminate the WYLBUR multiple active file logic error
                                    8260              *   that occurs when:
                                    8261              *
                                    8262              *   A) You have multiple active files
                                    8263              *   B) You've never VIEWed anything at all since you logged on
                                    8264              *   C) The active file space is now full
                                    8265              *   D) You issue a VIEW command.
                                    8266              *
                                    8267              *   This will cause a WYLBUR CPU loop, because ACTXPUT can't
                                    8268              *   put a VIEW record in.

0000000                00000 001B0 11245              APURGEWA RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            11253  1           APURINF    DS    XL(L'AINFO)         Working AINFO area
                                   11254  1
 0001A8                            11255  1           APURBYCT   DS    F                   Prev Active's byte count
 0001AC                            11256  1           APURLNCT   DS    F                   Prev Active's line count
 0001B0                001B0 001B0 11257                       END
-                                  11267              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   11268              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   11269              Ÿ  ACTPURGE -- Routine to purge (delete) old cleared Active files     Ÿ
                                   11270              Ÿ    if the user is using a lot of Active file space.  We will        Ÿ
                                   11271              Ÿ    purge the oldest cleared Active file and continue with more      Ÿ
                                   11272              Ÿ    recent cleared Active files until the user is under the file     Ÿ
                                   11273              Ÿ    space threshold.                                                 Ÿ
                                   11274              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   11275              Ÿ    We will never delete the most recently cleared Active file.      Ÿ
                                   11276              Ÿ    This means that the user can guarantee that he can retreive      Ÿ
                                   11277              Ÿ    the last Active file he cleared; and there is a "best effort"    Ÿ
                                   11278              Ÿ    to keep older cleared Active files around.  Now is that          Ÿ
                                   11279              Ÿ    user-friendly to the max or what!                                Ÿ
                                   11280              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   11281              Ÿ    If the user only has one huge cleared Active file and we are     Ÿ
                                   11282              Ÿ    going to run the risk of running out of space then we will       Ÿ
                                   11283              Ÿ    purge the most recently cleared Active file.                     Ÿ
                                   11284              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
0000D72 50E0 D000/9008_      00000 11285              ACTPURGE PROC  APURGEWA
 USING  *,R7
 USING  APURGEWA-(4+36),R8

                                   11336                       Ÿ  Check to see if it's time to purge cleared Actives.  Ÿ
                                   11337                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0                                  11602              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   11603              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   11604              Ÿ  ACTGINFO -- Routine to return the Active file information record   Ÿ
                                   11605              Ÿ    to the caller.                                                   Ÿ
                                   11606              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   11607              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   11608              Ÿ      R1,R0 - AINFO loc, len                                         Ÿ
                                   11609              Ÿ      R15 - Active file set number                                   Ÿ
                                   11610              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   11611              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and cc):                                           Ÿ
                                   11612              Ÿ          0   = ok                                                   Ÿ
                                   11613              Ÿ          pos = no such Active file                                  Ÿ

0                                  12457              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   12458              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   12459              Ÿ  ACTXPUT -- Routine to do an XPUT into the Active file.             Ÿ
                                   12460              Ÿ    This routine is used to put control "lines" (such as the         Ÿ
                                   12461              Ÿ    AINFO) in to the Active file.  Regular data lines are added      Ÿ
                                   12462              Ÿ    via PUTLINE (not by this code).                                  Ÿ
                                   12463              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   12464              Ÿ    Special care is taken to first try an in place replacement       Ÿ
                                   12465              Ÿ    of the line, so we won't get tripped up trying to replace        Ÿ
                                   12466              Ÿ    an AINFO record in an Active file which is full.  (See           Ÿ
                                   12467              Ÿ    comments in XREPLACE in the RECS modules for more info.)         Ÿ
                                   12468              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   12469              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   12470              Ÿ      R1,R0 - data loc, len                                          Ÿ
                                   12471              Ÿ      @R2 - key data ptr (lineno)                                    Ÿ
                                   12472              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   12473              Ÿ    Returns only if OK.                                              Ÿ
                                   12474              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ

                                   17265              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   17266              Ÿ  GETLINFO -- Routine to get a line from the Active file.            Ÿ
                                   17267              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   17268              Ÿ  ** NOTE: **                                                        Ÿ
                                   17269              Ÿ  AS OF OCTOBER 1990, THIS INFORMATION IS NO LONGER KEPT.            Ÿ
                                   17270              Ÿ  THIS ROUTINE JUST RETURNS ZEROS TO INFO AREA.                      Ÿ
                                   17271              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   17272              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   17273              Ÿ      R15 - line-number of line to get                               Ÿ
                                   17274              Ÿ      R1,R0 - put line info here (loc, len)                          Ÿ
                                   17275              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   17276              Ÿ    On exit:                                                         Ÿ
                                   17277              Ÿ      R1 - AREA ZEROED UP TO (CEIL R0,L'LNINFO) BYTES                Ÿ
                                   17278              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   17279              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   18148              Ÿ  PUTLINEX -- Routine to add/replace a line in the Active file.      Ÿ
                                   18149              Ÿ    This entry point is used when the caller needs to pass special   Ÿ
                                   18150              Ÿ    options.                                                         Ÿ
                                   18151              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   18152              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   18153              Ÿ      R15   - line-number                                            Ÿ
                                   18154              Ÿ      R1,R0 - line text loc, len                                     Ÿ
                                   18155              Ÿ      @R2   - four character options flags:                          Ÿ
                                   18156              Ÿ                 "...." - nothing special                            Ÿ
                                   18157              Ÿ                 "I..." - Insert mode only                           Ÿ
                                   18158              Ÿ                 "R..." - Replace mode only                          Ÿ
                                   18159              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   18160              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and cc):                                           Ÿ

                                   18162              Ÿ     -4 - can't insert/replace because of option setting             Ÿ

0                                  19055              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   19056              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19057              Ÿ  PUTBYTES -- Routine to put a stream of bytes in to the Active      Ÿ
                                   19058              Ÿ    file based on the options specified in the PUTWA.                Ÿ
                                   19059              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19060              Ÿ    Note:  This routine currently assumes that the data is an        Ÿ
                                   19061              Ÿ      ASCII stream of bytes.  If it were ever necessary, a flag      Ÿ
                                   19062              Ÿ      could be added to the PUTCB saying that the data was in        Ÿ
                                   19063              Ÿ      EBCDIC.                                                        Ÿ
                                   19064              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19065              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   19066              Ÿ      R1,R0 - buffer loc, len  (R0 = -1 = flush buffer request)      Ÿ
                                   19067              Ÿ      R15 - PUTCB ptr                                                Ÿ
                                   19068              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19069              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and cc):                                           Ÿ
                                   19070              Ÿ      0 - ok                                                         Ÿ
                                   19071              Ÿ      4 - time to stop (count exhausted, stop text match, etc.)      Ÿ
                                   19072              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   19853              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19854              Ÿ  PUTBLINE -- Local routine to save a line of text in the Active     Ÿ
                                   19855              Ÿ    file.  This is a subroutine of PUTBYTES which handles            Ÿ
                                   19856              Ÿ    wrapping/splitting the line if it is too long, and also          Ÿ
                                   19857              Ÿ    handles translation and stop character checking.                 Ÿ
                                   19858              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19859              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   19860              Ÿ      R15 - flag: 0=normal                                           Ÿ
                                   19861              Ÿ                  1=save last line in residual buffer                Ÿ
                                   19862              Ÿ      R1,R0 - line loc, len                                          Ÿ
                                   19863              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   19864              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and cc):                                           Ÿ
                                   19865              Ÿ      0 - ok                                                         Ÿ
                                   19866              Ÿ      4 - time to stop (count exhausted, stop text match, etc.)      Ÿ

                                   22333              Ÿ  JOINLINE -- Routine to join two lines.                             Ÿ
                                   22334              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   22335              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   22336              Ÿ      R0 - Flag:  0=normal;                                          Ÿ

                                   22338              Ÿ                  2=use next line's line-number                      Ÿ

                                   23407              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23408              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23409              Ÿ  CHKLINES -- Routine to verify that there are enough new            Ÿ
                                   23410              Ÿ    line-numbers to add new lines.  This routine will renumber       Ÿ
                                   23411              Ÿ    existing lines to provide enough space, if necessary.            Ÿ
                                   23412              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23413              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   23414              Ÿ      R15 - line-number; caller wants to add lines after this one    Ÿ
                                   23415              Ÿ      R0  - number of lines to be added                              Ÿ
                                   23416              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23417              Ÿ    On exit:                                                         Ÿ
                                   23418              Ÿ      R15 - line-number; same as on entry                            Ÿ
                                   23419              Ÿ            (unless there was a renumber)                            Ÿ
                                   23420              Ÿ      R1  - delta to use                                             Ÿ
                                   23421              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23422              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23423              Ÿ  Note:                                                              Ÿ
                                   23424              Ÿ    - 1st we see if lines will fit in space,  if not we look         Ÿ
                                   23425              Ÿ      for a range that will hold lines if renumbered                 Ÿ
                                   23426              Ÿ    - The area for renumbering grows as follows 1, 1*2, 1*2*4,       Ÿ
                                   23427              Ÿ      1*2*4*8, 1*2*4*8*16,,, etc,,, this is fast!                    Ÿ
                                   23428              Ÿ    - The area to be renumbered is renumbered in 2 parts,            Ÿ
                                   23429              Ÿ      before and after the line to be inserted.                      Ÿ
                                   23430              Ÿ    - This routine has a few hard coded dependecies,  .01 is         Ÿ
                                   23431              Ÿ      the minimum delta accepted (change only with caution!).        Ÿ
                                   23432              Ÿ      Also the minimum area renumbered starts at 1 regardless        Ÿ
                                   23433              Ÿ      of users delta.                                                Ÿ
                                   23434              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   23435              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   24205              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24206              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24207              Ÿ  AUTONUMB - NUMBER RANGE, OPENING UP AN INSERT AREA                 Ÿ
                                   24208              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24209              Ÿ  ON ENTRY:                                                          Ÿ
                                   24210              Ÿ       R0 - START OF RANGE                                           Ÿ
                                   24211              Ÿ       R1 - END OF RANGE                                             Ÿ
                                   24212              Ÿ       R2 - LINE NUMBER TO INSERT AFTER                              Ÿ
                                   24213              Ÿ       R3 - RAW DELTA FOR RENUMBER  (MUST BE >= .01)                 Ÿ
                                   24214              Ÿ       R4 - LINES TO INSERT (FOR VALIDITY CHECKING)                  Ÿ
                                   24215              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24216              Ÿ  ON EXIT:                                                           Ÿ
                                   24217              Ÿ       R0 - DELTA TO USE FOR INSERT                                  Ÿ
                                   24218              Ÿ       R1 - LINE TO INSERT AFTER (MAY OR MAY NOT BE SAME)            Ÿ
                                   24219              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24220              Ÿ  NOTE: THE RANGE IS RENUMBERED IN TWO PARTS THE PART BEFORE         Ÿ
                                   24221              Ÿ    THE PLACE TO INSERT AND THE PART AFTER THE PLACE TO INSERT.      Ÿ
                                   24222              Ÿ    THIS, IN EFFECT, OPENS UP A RANGE FOR INSERTING LINES.           Ÿ
                                   24223              Ÿ  NOTE: CALLER TO THIS ROUTINE MUST GUARANTEE, THAT THE GIVEN        Ÿ
                                   24224              Ÿ    RANGE WILL HOLD ALL THE OLD+NEW LINES USING THE DELTA            Ÿ
                                   24225              Ÿ    SPECIFIED.  IF NOT, THIS ROUTINE WILL FAIL.                      Ÿ
                                   24226              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24227              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   24228              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ

                                   25029              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25030              Ÿ  NUMRANGE -- Routine to re-number range of lines in the             Ÿ
                                   25031              Ÿ    Active file.                                                     Ÿ
                                   25032              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25033              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   25034              Ÿ       R0 - start of range                                           Ÿ
                                   25035              Ÿ       R1 - end of range                                             Ÿ
                                   25036              Ÿ       R2 - delta factor (0 = calculate best)                        Ÿ
                                   25037              Ÿ       R3 - new starting lineno, (-1 if none)                        Ÿ
                                   25038              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25039              Ÿ    On Exit:                                                         Ÿ
                                   25040              Ÿ       R0 - last line-number in re-numbered range (if CC=zero)       Ÿ
                                   25041              Ÿ       R2 - actual delta used                                        Ÿ
                                   25042              Ÿ      R15 - CC=zero, success                                         Ÿ
                                   25043              Ÿ            RC=4  - bad delta (never given--handled internally)      Ÿ
                                   25044              Ÿ            RC=8  - no lines found                                   Ÿ
                                   25045              Ÿ            RC=12 - bad range                                        Ÿ
                                   25046              Ÿ            RC=16 - rounding error (number times)                    Ÿ
                                   25047              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25048              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ

0                                  25435              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   25436              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25437              Ÿ  NUMFACT -- Routine to re-number range of lines in the              Ÿ
                                   25438              Ÿ    Active file by multiplying/adding a factor to the existing       Ÿ
                                   25439              Ÿ    line-numbers.                                                    Ÿ
                                   25440              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25441              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   25442              Ÿ       R0 - start of range                                           Ÿ
                                   25443              Ÿ       R1 - end of range                                             Ÿ
                                   25444              Ÿ       R2 - signed addition factor                                   Ÿ
                                   25445              Ÿ       R3 - multiplication factor (-1 if none)                       Ÿ
                                   25446              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25447              Ÿ    On Exit:                                                         Ÿ
                                   25448              Ÿ       R0 - last line-number in re-numbered range (if CC=zero)       Ÿ
                                   25449              Ÿ      R15 - CC=zero, success                                         Ÿ
                                   25450              Ÿ            RC=4  - bad PLUS/TIMES                                   Ÿ
                                   25451              Ÿ            RC=8  - no lines found                                   Ÿ
                                   25452              Ÿ            RC=12 - bad range                                        Ÿ
                                   25453              Ÿ            RC=16 - rounding error (number times)                    Ÿ
                                   25454              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25455              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0                                  25668              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   25669              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   25670              Ÿ  NOTE !!!                                                           Ÿ
                                   25671              Ÿ  The routines below provide access to the active file.              Ÿ
                                   25672              Ÿ  Routines use  a RECS-like interface, they bypass the RANGE         Ÿ
                                   25673              Ÿ  processor and do not use or set any active file range              Ÿ
                                   25674              Ÿ  variables (eg. CURRENT).  These routines present a common          Ÿ
                                   25675              Ÿ  interface for the lower level GETLINE, PUTLINE routines.           Ÿ
                                   25676              Ÿ  (written by the chump, for all chumps!)                            Ÿ
                                   25677              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0000000                00000 000F7 28453              STOWWA   RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            28461  1           STOWLNO    DS    F                   Working line-number
 000004                            28462  1           STOWPTRS   DS    2A                  Line loc, len
                                   28463  1           STOWTEXT   DS    CL(&LINESZ)         Working line text area
 00000C                                   1          +STOWTEXT   DS    CL(235)             Working line text area

-                                  28474              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   28475              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   28476              Ÿ  STOW -- For compatability only!  New callers should use the        Ÿ
                                   28477              Ÿ    PUTLINE routine.  This routine will add/replace a line in        Ÿ
                                   28478              Ÿ    the Active file.                                                 Ÿ
                                   28479              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   28480              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   28481              Ÿ      R1 - pressed line ptr (before lineno)                          Ÿ
                                   28482              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   28483              Ÿ      CPLFLG4:                                                       Ÿ
                                   28484              Ÿ        CPFSTINS - insert mode only                                  Ÿ
                                   28485              Ÿ        CPFSTREP - replace mode only                                 Ÿ
                                   28486              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   28487              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and CC):                                           Ÿ
                                   28488              Ÿ     -4 - replace/insert mode prevented STOW                         Ÿ
                                   28489              Ÿ      0 - OK                                                         Ÿ
                                   28490              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ

0                                  30043                       COPY  ASRWA
 000000                00000 00010 30044             =ASRWA    RECORD BEGIN
                                   30052  1          =*
                                   30053  1          =*  Define the string work area for each string in an associative
                                   30054  1          =*  range.
                                   30055  1          =*
 000000                            30056  1          =ASRPTR     DS    F                   Pointer to next work area
                                   30057  1          =*ASRFLAG EQU   ASRPTR,1,C'X'       Flag (use first byte of ptr)
 000004 00                         30058  1          =ASRFLAG    FLAG  ,                   Flag (*DO NOT* use HOB of ptr)
                                   30062  1          =ASRFBLKR   EQU   X'80'               - Blank (null) range flag
                                   30063  1          =ASRFONER   EQU   X'40'               - Start column only given
                                   30064  1          =ASRFLIMR   EQU   X'20'               - Limited col range given
                                   30065  1          =ASRFTEXT   EQU   X'10'               - C'STRING' -- ignore case
                                   30066  1          =ASRFPAT    EQU   X'08'               - P'PATTERN' -- Pattern match
                                   30067  1          =
 000006                            30068  1          =ASRBVAL    DS    H                   Branch table value
                                   30069  1          =*  0 = last string, 'string' specified
                                   30070  1          =*  4 = last string, ~'string' specified
                                   30071  1          =*  8 = and condition - not last string, 'string' specified
                                   30072  1          =* 12 = and condition - not last string, ~'string' specified
                                   30073  1          =* 16 =  or condition - not last string, 'string' specified
                                   30074  1          =* 20 =  or condition - not last string, ~'string' specified
                                   30075  1          =* the branch table value is used after it is found that the
                                   30076  1          =* string is either in the current line or not in it.
 000008                            30077  1          =ASRSCOL    DS    H                   Starting column-1 if given
 00000A                            30078  1          =ASRCOMP    DS    H                   No. of compares if 2 cols
 00000C                            30079  1          =ASRPLEN    DS    H                   Minimum match size for pattern
 00000E                            30080  1          =ASRSTRLN   DS    H                   Length of this string-1
 000010                            30081  1          =ASRSTRNG   DS    0C                  Start of string
 000010                00010 00010 30082             =         END
1ACT      (ACT2025) (12:40) (15MAR04) DETRNG Routine                                                                        Page  131
0Current Usings:  (CP,R11) (CV,R12)

0                                  30092              *
                                   30093              *   scan range
                                   30094              *
                                   30095              *   type help range for details
                                   30096              *
                                   30097              *   set cpfall flag to allow range to default to all
                                   30098              *   if not specified. (eg. list command does this)
                                   30099              *
                                   30100              *
                                   30101              *   note:
                                   30102              *   many range specification errors, return via CVERROR
                                   30103              *
                                   30104              *   note:
                                   30105              *   this routine scans a range specification.  this is
                                   30106              *   done by a 'finite state' type algorithm.  each scan
                                   30107              *   table represents a 'state' (more or less).  we scan
                                   30108              *   by scanning using the various scan tables.  we have
                                   30109              *   (a) general scan, (b) explicit range scan, and
                                   30110              *   (c) associtive (string) range sckws and code in this
                                   30111              *   order.
                                   30112              *
                                   30113              *   note:
                                   30114              *   this routine scans a range specification.  it sets
                                   30115              *   up cp flags and cp areas with the range specification
                                   30116              *   info.  this info is used by the range processor to
                                   30117              *   determine what lines constitute the range.  we note
                                   30118              *   that the fields set in the cp are somewhat poorly
                                   30119              *   documented.  unfortunately that is still the case.
                                   30120              *   as it has been said ..
                                   30121              *      real programmers don't comment.  read the code.
                                   30122              *
                                   30123              *
 000000                00000 00003 30124              DRWA     RECORD BEGIN
 000000 00                         30132  1           DRFLAG     FLAG  ,
 DRFLAG.DRFAND     80 ONES         30136  1                      FLAG  DRFAND              AND
 DRFLAG.DRFOR      40 ONES         30141  1                      FLAG  DRFOR               OR
 DRFLAG.DRFIN      20 ONES         30146  1                      FLAG  DRFIN               IN
 000001 00                         30151  1           DRFLAG2    FLAG  ,                   PER STRING FLAGS
 DRFLAG2.DRFNOT    80 ONES         30155  1                      FLAG  DRFNOT              NOT
 DRFLAG2.DRFCTEXT  40 ONES         30160  1                      FLAG  DRFCTEXT            C'TEXT'
 DRFLAG2.DRFHEX    20 ONES         30165  1                      FLAG  DRFHEX              HEX
 DRFLAG2.DRFPAT    10 ONES         30170  1                      FLAG  DRFPAT              PATTERN
 000002 00                         30175  1           DRFLAG3    FLAG  ,                   COMPLETION FLAGS
 DRFLAG3.DRFNEEDS  80 ONES         30179  1                      FLAG  DRFNEEDS            NEED STRING FLAG
 DRFLAG3.DRFNEEDX  40 ONES         30184  1                      FLAG  DRFNEEDX            NEED EXPLICIT RANGE FLAG
 000003                00003 00003 30189                       END
                                   30198              *
                                   30199              *

0                                  32329              *
                                   32330              *  PROCESS X/Y RANGE, OR X (Y) RANGE
                                   32331              *
                                   32332              *  ON ENTRY: X SCANNED, AND R0 = X VALUE
                                   32333              *  ON EXIT: R0 = Y VALUE, WITH FLAGS SET FOR X/Y OR X (Y) FORM
                                   32334              *           R15 = 0 IF X/Y OR X (Y), R15 = NZ OTHERWISE
                                   32335              *           SCAN CONTROL BLOCK UPDATED IF X/Y OR X (Y)
                                   32336              *
 004F90 50E0 D000/9008_      00000 32337              DOXLINE2 PROC  ,
 USING  *,R7
 004FAA 1840                       32376                       LR    R4,R0
 004FAC 58E0 B08C/D2AF_      0008C 32377                       SCPUSH ,
 004FBA 5810 B08C/1B00_      0008C 32383                       SCAN ,
 005008 58E0 7B0E/0DEE       05AB8 32414                       SCANCHK
                                   32419                       COMMENT                   IF X/Y RANGE
 00500E 5900 7B06/4770_      05AB0 32420                       IF    ((R0,EQ,1),AND,(@R1,EQ,'/')),BEGIN
 00501E 94EF BD88      00D88       32452  1                      CLEAR CPFONEL
 005022 5810 B08C/1B00_      0008C 32459  1                      SCAN  EX2SYMLN
 005074 1803                       32491  1                      LR    R0,R3
 005076 1934/47B0 70DE             32492  1                      IF    (R3,LT,R4),BEGIN
 00507C 4110 7B16/4100_      05AC0 32507  2                        ERROR 'Invalid range.  Line-numbers are decreasing.'
 005088                            32514  1                      END
 005088 5600 7B42            05AEC 32518  1                      O     R0,=X'C0000000'  X/Y RANGE
 00508C 1BFF                       32519  1                      CLEAR R15
 00508E                            32523                       END
                                   32527                       COMMENT                   IF X (Y) RANGE
 00508E 70E8/70E8/47F0_0508E 05014 32528                       ELSEIF ((@R1,EQ,'('),AND,(R0,GT,2)),BEGIN
 0050A2 94EF BD88      00D88       32571  1                      CLEAR CPFONEL

 0050B4 5E10 7B06            05AB0 32584  1                      INCR  R1
 0050B8 0600                       32587  1                      DECR  R0

                                   34214              *
                                   34215              * the following code handles the scan of strings in a range
                                   34216              * the registers used by this code are:
                                   34217              *        R3 = 0 for 'string' or 4 for ~'string'
                                   34218              *        R4 = 0 for first string, 8 if and is used or 16 for or
                                   34219              *        R5 = pointer to current string work area
                                   34220              *
                                   34221              * NOTE ABOVE NOW SET FROM FLAGS.  (YUCK AND MUCK, WAS ONCE WORSE)
                                   34222              *
                                   34223              *

                                   37233              * the registers used by this code are:

0                                  38928              ***********************************************************************
                                   38929              *   PENCODE -- Encode the Pattern String
                                   38930              *
                                   38931              *   On entry:   R1,R0 - Pattern string descriptor
                                   38932              *               R15 -> Area to put encoded pattern string
                                   38933              *   On exit:    R1,R0 - Encoded Pattern string descriptor
                                   38934              *               R15 - Holds length of minimum match
                                   38935              ***********************************************************************
 000000                00000 000EF 38936              PCWA     RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            38944  1           PCPTR      DS    F
                                   38945  1           PCAREA     DS    CL(&LINESZ)
 000004                                   1          +PCAREA     DS    CL(235)
 0000EF                000EF 000EF 38946                       END
                                   38955
 006FCA 50E0 D000/9008_      00000 38956              PENCODE  PROC  PCWA
 DROP   *,R7
 USING  *,R7
 USING  PCWA-(4+36),R8
 006FE4 183F                       39009                       LR    R3,R15              R3 -> Pattern constuction area
 006FE6 4160 30C8            000C8 39010                       LA    R6,@R3+&PATMAX      Arbitrary maximum
 006FEA 41F0 802C            00004 39011                       LA    R15,PCAREA          R15 -> Area for dequoted string
 006FEE 58E0 7444/0DEE       07428 39012                       VCALL DEQSTR              Dequote the string
                                   39016              *        IF    M,'VCALL NOTVALID'  Invalid string ...
 006FF4 47B0 7020            07004 39017                       IF    M,BEGIN
 006FF8 4110 7448/4100_      0742C 39028  1                      ERROR 'Missing (invalid) quotes for pattern string.'
 007004                            39035                       END
 007004 1200/47D0 7248             39039                       IF    (R0,NP),PENCODEX    Zip - let DETRNG handle null string
000700A 1843                       39057                       LR    R4,R3               R4 -> Pattern constuction area
 00700C 5030 8028            00000 39058                       ST    R3,PCPTR            Save pointer to start of encoding
 007010 1B33                       39059                       CLEAR R3                  Clear minimun match length
 007012 1200/4780 7232             39063                       WHILE (R0,NZ),BEGIN       Process pattern ...
 007018 954C 1000/4770_00000       39079  1                      IF    ((@R1,NE,'<'),OR,((@R1,EQ,'<<'),AND,(R0,GE,2))),BEGIN
 007032 1BFF                       39126  2                        CLEAR R15                 Clear literal string length
 007034 92D3 4000      00000       39130  2                        MVI   @R4,C'L'            Flag entry as literal
 007038 4124 0002            00002 39131  2                        LA    R2,2(R4)            Skip to literal hold area
 00703C 1926/47D0 7064_            39132  2                        IF    (R2,GT,R6),' ACALL PATMAXL'  Check limit
 007048 1200/47D0 70F2             39156  2                        WHILE (R0,POS),BEGIN
 00704E 954C 1000/4780_00000       39172  3                          IF    ((@R1,EQ,'<'),OR,(@R1,EQ,'>')),BEGIN
 00705E D501 74C8 1000_074AC 00000 39203  4                            IF    (((@R1,EQ,'<<'),OR,(@R1,EQ,'>>')),AND,(R0,GE,2)),BEGIN
 00707A D200 2000 1000 00000 00000 39250  5                              MVC   @R2(1),@R1          Move the caret
 007080 5EF0 747C            07460 39251  5                              INCR  R15                 We moved one char ...
 007084 5E20 747C            07460 39254  5                              INCR  R2                  Skip to next pattern slot
 007088 1926/47D0 70B0_            39257  5                              IF    (R2,GT,R6),' ACALL PATMAXL'  Check limit
 007094 4111 0002            00002 39281  5                              LA    R1,2(R1)            Skip over carets
 007098 4B00 74CC            074B0 39282  5                              SH    R0,=H'2'            Adjust len
 00709C 70BC/70BC/47F0_0709C 07070 39283  4                            END   ELSE,BEGIN
 0070A0 954C 1000/4780_00000       39300  5                              IF    (@R1,EQ,'<'),PATLEND
 0070A8 58E0 7480/0DEE       07464 39319  5                              ACALL PUNBAL              Unbalanced carets ...
 0070AE                            39323  4                            END   ,

0                                  40756              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   40757              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40758              Ÿ  RDRNG (READ RANGE) the new DESPOT.                                 Ÿ
                                   40759              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40760              Ÿ  ON ENTRY:                                                          Ÿ
                                   40761              Ÿ        R0 - FLAGS, DESCRIBED BELOW                                  Ÿ
                                   40762              Ÿ        R1 - CO-ROUTINE ADDRESS, THIS ROUTINE RECEIVES               Ÿ
                                   40763              Ÿ             CONTROL EACH TIME A LINE IN THE RANGE IS LOCATED.       Ÿ
                                   40764              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40765              Ÿ  R0 contais a flag byte with the following codes:                   Ÿ
                                   40766              Ÿ     DESRTRN = X'80' - means leave DESPOT with return                Ÿ
                                   40767              Ÿ     DESNRTN = X'00' - means leave DESPOT and return for next cmd    Ÿ
                                   40768              Ÿ    LEXATRTN = X'40' - means use EXLOCATE                            Ÿ
                                   40769              Ÿ    LXCATRTN = X'60' - means use LXCATE                              Ÿ
                                   40770              Ÿ    LOCATRTN = X'00' - means use LOCATE                              Ÿ
                                   40771              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40772              Ÿ    UNPRST,PREST WILL BE REMOVED FOR RDRNG (DESPOT) ABOUT 5/91       Ÿ
                                   40773              Ÿ    BY GG.SCH,,, ALL RDRNG CALLS WILL RETURN UNPRESSED               Ÿ
                                   40774              Ÿ       PREST = X'00' - return pressed line (R15 points to it)        Ÿ
                                   40775              Ÿ      UNPRST = X'01' - return unpressed line (R1=loc, R0=len)        Ÿ
                                   40776              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40777              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40778              Ÿ    DESABORT = X'04' - means that attention can interrupt range      Ÿ
                                   40779              Ÿ    DESABORT = X'00' - means that attention will be ignored          Ÿ
                                   40780              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40781              Ÿ  Both explicit and associative ranges are handled.                  Ÿ
                                   40782              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   40783              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   44956              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   44957              Ÿ  LOCATE -- For compatability only!  New callers should use the      Ÿ
                                   44958              Ÿ    GETLINE routine.  The Active file is no longer kept in           Ÿ
                                   44959              Ÿ    pressed format so in order to return a pressed line to the       Ÿ
                                   44960              Ÿ    caller we get a little heap space and build a pressed line.      Ÿ
                                   44961              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   44962              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   44963              Ÿ      R1 - ptr to line-number                                        Ÿ
                                   44964              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   44965              Ÿ    On exit:                                                         Ÿ
                                   44966              Ÿ      R15 - points to a "pressed line image"                         Ÿ
                                   44967              Ÿ      CPLCNO - line-number of located line                           Ÿ
                                   44968              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ

                                   44970              Ÿ      CPFNTYT - X'80' - ACTIVE file is empty.                        Ÿ

                                   44972              Ÿ                        with CPLCNO not set                          Ÿ

-                                  45497              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   45498              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   45499              Ÿ  MATLINE -- Routine to highlight any text on a line that is part    Ÿ
                                   45500              Ÿ    of the current associative range.  This routine is called by     Ÿ
                                   45501              Ÿ    the page manager for the VIEW command.                           Ÿ
                                   45502              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   45503              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   45504              Ÿ      CPLCNO - line-number                                           Ÿ
                                   45505              Ÿ      R1     - line loc (must be &LINESZ long)                       Ÿ
                                   45506              Ÿ      R2     - rendition line buffer or zero                         Ÿ
                                   45507              Ÿ                 (this shadows the line buffer ptr in R1)            Ÿ
                                   45508              Ÿ      R15    - column must be after this for a match                 Ÿ
                                   45509              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   45510              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and cc):                                           Ÿ
                                   45511              Ÿ      0   - no match                                                 Ÿ
                                   45512              Ÿ      pos - column number of first match                             Ÿ
                                   45513              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   45514              Ÿ    Note:  The X'02' bit is set for every character of the matched   Ÿ
                                   45515              Ÿ           string in the rendition buffer.                           Ÿ
                                   45516              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
